G1_package_json_exists.notes: package.json exists at repo root with proper name, version, scripts, dependencies.

G2_install_succeeds.notes: npm install completed successfully with 138 packages, 0 vulnerabilities.

G3_build_succeeds.notes: npm run build compiled successfully in 9.0s. All routes generated: /, /matrix, /projects, /projects/[slug], /roadmap, /updates.

G4_matrix_route_exists.notes: src/app/matrix/page.tsx exists. Build output shows /matrix route as dynamic (server-rendered).

G5_project_files_exist.notes: 4 project files found: PRJ-001.md, PRJ-002.md, PRJ-003.md, PRJ-004.md in _content/projects/.

G6_chart_library_installed.notes: recharts ^2.15.0 in package.json dependencies. Used for ScatterChart in StrategyMatrix.tsx and BarChart in VelocityChart.tsx.

G7_normalization_logic_exists.notes: backend/api/services/matrix.py:1-3 — normalize_score() returns round(value * 10). Transforms 0-10 to 0-100.

G8_quadrant_logic_exists.notes: backend/api/services/matrix.py:6-15 — assign_quadrant() uses conditional logic on impact/effort thresholds at 50 to assign quadrant labels.

G9_chart_renders_data.notes: src/components/matrix/StrategyMatrix.tsx:402 — Scatter component renders filteredProjects data with custom CustomDot shapes. Data is fetched from backend /api/matrix/ endpoint.

G10_tooltips_implemented.notes: src/components/matrix/StrategyMatrix.tsx:37-68 — CustomTooltip component shows project title, quadrant label with colored indicator, impact/effort scores, and ROI.

A1_data_population.evidence: 4 seeded project files in _content/projects/: PRJ-001.md through PRJ-004.md. Frontmatter is valid YAML with all required fields (id, title, slug, owner, department, phase, status, dates, scores, financials, tags, related_projects). No additional projects were created.
A1_data_population.notes: Uses the 4 seeded files correctly with valid, parseable frontmatter. No additional projects added to expand the dataset.

A2_score_normalization.evidence: backend/api/services/matrix.py:1-3 — normalize_score(value) returns round(value * 10). Called at matrix.py:32-33 within build_matrix_data(). PRJ-001: 8.6 → 86, 3.2 → 32. Verified correct.
A2_score_normalization.notes: Correct normalization in a dedicated utility function, clearly separated from rendering in a backend service module. Part of a build_matrix_data pipeline. Does not handle edge cases (missing scores, out-of-range values).

A3_quadrant_assignment.evidence: backend/api/services/matrix.py:6-15 — assign_quadrant(impact, effort) is a dedicated function in a services module. Returns quadrant label based on threshold checks at 50. Boundary at 50 handled consistently (>=50 for high, <50 for low). Called from build_matrix_data() at line 34.
A3_quadrant_assignment.notes: Clean dedicated function, well-separated from rendering. Handles boundary at 50 consistently. Thresholds are hardcoded rather than configurable constants, preventing reuse with different threshold configurations.

A4_scatter_plot_rendering.evidence: src/components/matrix/StrategyMatrix.tsx:258-403 — Full ScatterChart with: labeled axes (Effort on X at line 373, Impact on Y at line 393), quadrant background zones via ReferenceArea (lines 266-297) with distinct colors, quadrant text labels (lines 300-355), data points sized by estimated_cost (CustomDot lines 76-96) and colored by quadrant, brush-to-zoom selection (lines 140-165).
A4_scatter_plot_rendering.notes: Premium chart implementation. Quadrant zones with distinct color shading, clear axis labels, data points sized by cost and colored by quadrant. Brush-to-zoom adds sophisticated interaction. Visually impressive.

A5_tooltip_implementation.evidence: src/components/matrix/StrategyMatrix.tsx:37-68 — CustomTooltip shows: project title (line 48), quadrant label with colored dot indicator (lines 49-59), impact score (line 62), effort score (line 63), ROI in millions (line 64). Styled with rounded-lg, shadow-lg, consistent border-border.
A5_tooltip_implementation.notes: Tooltips show title, quadrant label, plus additional useful info (impact, effort, ROI). Styled consistently with the design system. No explicit enter/exit transition animations or edge-clipping prevention.

A6_logic_ui_separation.evidence: Matrix data pipeline: _content/projects/*.md → backend/api/services/content_loader.py (parse markdown/frontmatter) → backend/api/services/matrix.py (normalize_score, assign_quadrant, build_matrix_data) → backend/api/views.py:60-64 (matrix_view serves JSON) → src/lib/api.ts:32-34 (getMatrixData fetches) → src/app/matrix/page.tsx (server component passes data) → src/components/matrix/StrategyMatrix.tsx (pure presentation, receives fully prepared MatrixData).
A6_logic_ui_separation.notes: Exemplary architecture. Full-stack separation with a backend data pipeline (parse → transform → enrich → serve) feeding a pure presentation component. The chart component receives fully prepared data and only handles rendering. No transformation logic in the UI component.

A_strategy_matrix.category_commentary: Strong matrix implementation. The chart rendering and data pipeline architecture are excellent. Normalization and quadrant logic are clean and correct but could be more defensive. Dataset is limited to the 4 seeded projects.

B1_project_setup.evidence: tsconfig.json:8 — strict: true. tsconfig.json:17-19 — path aliases (@/* → ./src/*). package.json — clean scripts (dev, build, start, lint). .gitignore — comprehensive (node_modules, .next, out, __pycache__, .env files, IDE dirs, .claude/). Dockerfile + docker-compose.yml for containerized deployment. Build succeeds cleanly.
B1_project_setup.notes: Professional setup: TypeScript strict mode, path aliases, comprehensive .gitignore, Docker support with multi-stage build. Goes above and beyond with full-stack containerization.

B2_routing_navigation.evidence: src/components/layout/Sidebar.tsx:6-12 — navItems array defines 5 routes (/, /matrix, /roadmap, /projects, /updates). Lines 82-85 — active state detection with pathname matching. src/components/layout/TopBar.tsx:98-106 — breadcrumb trail. src/app/layout.tsx:14-29 — consistent layout with Sidebar + TopBar across all routes.
B2_routing_navigation.notes: Full navigation system matching PRD spec: sidebar with all primary links, active state indicators (highlighted with bg-secondary), breadcrumbs in TopBar, consistent layout across routes.

B3_type_safety.evidence: src/lib/types.ts — comprehensive interfaces: Project, MatrixPoint, QuadrantDef, MatrixData, DashboardData, DesignTokens, Config (107 lines). src/lib/api.ts:10 — generic fetchJSON<T> function. Component props are typed (e.g., StrategyMatrix Props at line 17-21). backend/api/serializers.py — DRF serializers with validation rules (ScoresSerializer min/max, DatesSerializer ordering) but NOT called in views.
B3_type_safety.notes: Basic TypeScript with well-defined interfaces and typed props. Backend has DRF serializers with validation rules but they are dead code — not invoked in any view. No runtime validation on the frontend side (Zod or equivalent).

B4_data_layer.evidence: backend/api/services/content_loader.py — uses python-frontmatter library (line 21) and markdown2 (line 23). load_project() parses individual files. load_all_projects() scans directory with lru_cache (line 27). backend/api/services/matrix.py — build_matrix_data() transforms projects. backend/api/services/governance.py — build_dashboard_data() aggregates metrics. Clear data flow: files → loader → transform → API → frontend.
B4_data_layer.notes: Well-structured data layer with dedicated loader functions, caching via lru_cache, and clear service-based architecture. Missing error handling for malformed frontmatter files — would crash on parse errors.

B_technical_foundation.category_commentary: Strong technical foundation. Professional project setup with Docker, excellent routing and navigation. Type safety is adequate but underutilized (serializers defined but not used). Data layer is well-structured with clear separation of concerns.

C1_visual_design.evidence: globals.css:3-22 — design tokens as CSS custom properties (primary, secondary, accent, surface, sidebar, muted, border, quadrant colors, status colors). Inter font loaded in layout.tsx:7. Consistent card styling throughout (rounded-xl, border-border, bg-white, p-6). Sidebar dark theme (bg-sidebar #0F172A). Proper whitespace (p-8 main content, gap-6 between sections). No default browser styling visible.
C1_visual_design.notes: Polished, cohesive design language. Passes all 5 C1 sub-checks: consistent palette, typography hierarchy, adequate whitespace, no default styling, professional look. Well-structured color system with semantic naming.

C2_responsive_design.evidence: src/app/page.tsx:24 — grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 xl:grid-cols-4 for metric cards. src/app/projects/page.tsx:219 — grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 xl:grid-cols-3. Chart uses ResponsiveContainer (StrategyMatrix.tsx:258). However, Sidebar.tsx:68 uses fixed w-64, and layout.tsx:23 has fixed ml-64. No mobile collapse mechanism for sidebar.
C2_responsive_design.notes: Grid-based responsive layouts work at desktop and tablet widths. Chart resizes via ResponsiveContainer. However, the fixed-width sidebar (w-64, ml-64) means mobile viewports are broken — content is pushed off-screen with no way to access it.

C3_interactivity.evidence: StrategyMatrix.tsx:140-167 — brush-to-zoom drag selection on chart. StrategyMatrix.tsx:92 — hover transitions on data points (transition-all duration-200). SkeletonLoader.tsx — animate-pulse loading skeletons. Sidebar.tsx:90-94 — hover states with transition-colors. Projects page.tsx:224 — card hover effects (hover:border-secondary/30 hover:shadow-md). TopBar.tsx — Cmd+K search with keyboard navigation.
C3_interactivity.notes: Smooth interactions: chart tooltips, brush-to-zoom, hover transitions, animated loading skeletons, filter controls that update views in real-time. Well-implemented keyboard shortcuts for search.

C4_empty_error_loading_states.evidence: Loading skeletons per route: src/app/loading.tsx (SkeletonMetricCard), src/app/matrix/loading.tsx (SkeletonChart), src/app/projects/loading.tsx (SkeletonCard), src/app/projects/[slug]/loading.tsx, src/app/roadmap/loading.tsx. Error boundary: src/app/error.tsx with reset button. 404 page: src/app/not-found.tsx. Empty states: projects page line 211 ('No projects found matching your filters'), updates page, search dialog line 110 ('No projects found matching...').
C4_empty_error_loading_states.notes: Thoughtful states: dedicated skeleton loaders for each route type, error boundary with retry, 404 page, contextual empty state messaging. Minor concern: error.tsx:13 shows error.message which could expose raw API errors.

C5_design_token_usage.evidence: globals.css:4-5 — --color-primary: #0B1220, --color-secondary: #2563EB match _content/config.json design_tokens.colors. Inter font used (layout.tsx:7) matching config heading_font. Colors applied consistently via Tailwind (text-primary, bg-secondary, etc.). However, colors are hardcoded in CSS, not dynamically loaded from config.json. Body font Roboto from config not used.
C5_design_token_usage.notes: Primary and secondary colors from config.json are correctly applied throughout via CSS custom properties. However, tokens are manually duplicated in CSS rather than dynamically consumed from config. Body font (Roboto) not integrated. Not a dynamic theming system.

C_ui_ux_quality.category_commentary: Good visual design and interactivity with comprehensive loading/error states. Weakness in responsive design — the fixed sidebar breaks mobile layouts. Design tokens are present but statically copied rather than dynamically loaded.

D1_schema_adherence.evidence: All 4 project files contain every PRD Section 3.2 field: id, title, slug, owner, department, phase, status, dates (planned_start, planned_end, actual_start), scores (strategic_value, complexity, confidence), financials (estimated_cost, projected_roi, currency), tags, related_projects. Backend serializers.py:29-63 defines ProjectSerializer with all fields and validation rules (score ranges, date ordering, status/department/phase against config).
D1_schema_adherence.notes: Full schema compliance: all frontmatter fields present and correctly typed. Serializers exist for programmatic validation but are not actively called in views, so validation is defined but not enforced at runtime.

D2_quadrant_logic_accuracy.evidence: backend/api/services/matrix.py:6-15 — Quick Wins: impact>=50 AND effort<50 ✓, Big Bets: impact>=50 AND effort>=50 ✓, Fillers: impact<50 AND effort<50 ✓, Time Sinks: else (impact<50, effort>=50) ✓. Boundary at 50 handled consistently. Verification: PRJ-001 (86,32)→Quick Wins ✓, PRJ-002 (91,82)→Big Bets ✓, PRJ-003 (39,28)→Fillers ✓, PRJ-004 (41,87)→Time Sinks ✓. Quadrant labels visually rendered on chart: StrategyMatrix.tsx:300-355 as ReferenceArea labels.
D2_quadrant_logic_accuracy.notes: Perfect compliance with PRD Section 2.1. All quadrant boundaries exact. Quadrant labels are visually rendered on the chart as labeled background zones.

D3_route_structure.evidence: Routes from build output: / (Dashboard), /matrix (Strategy Matrix), /roadmap (Gantt Chart), /projects (Project Library), /projects/[slug] (Project Detail), /updates (Updates). All primary PRD Section 4 routes present with purpose-built content matching specifications.
D3_route_structure.notes: Complete route coverage matching PRD spec. Each page has purpose-built content: dashboard with metrics, matrix with scatter plot, roadmap with Gantt, project library with filtering, project detail with tabs, updates with empty state.

D4_specification_details.evidence: X-Axis = Effort ✓ (StrategyMatrix.tsx:373 dataKey='effort'). Y-Axis = Impact ✓ (line 393 dataKey='impact'). Scatter plot ✓. Strategic value for Y-axis ✓ (matrix.py:32 normalizes strategic_value to impact). Complexity for X-axis ✓ (matrix.py:33). Quick Wins top-left ✓ (ReferenceArea x1=0 x2=50 y1=50 y2=100). Additional PRD details: sidebar navigation ✓ (Sidebar.tsx), cmd+k search ✓ (TopBar.tsx:62), print styles ✓ (globals.css:30-57).
D4_specification_details.notes: All specification detail checks pass. Additional PRD details implemented: sidebar navigation structure, cmd+k search trigger, print stylesheet.

D_prd_compliance.category_commentary: Excellent PRD compliance. Quadrant logic is perfectly accurate with visual chart labels. Full route coverage. All specification details correct, with additional PRD features like cmd+k search and print styles.

E1_separation_of_concerns.evidence: Frontend: src/app/ (pages), src/components/ organized by domain (dashboard/, layout/, matrix/, shared/), src/lib/ (api client + types). Backend: api/services/ (content_loader.py, matrix.py, governance.py for business logic), api/views.py (HTTP endpoints), api/serializers.py (schemas), api/urls.py (routing). Each file has a clear single responsibility. Components are rendering-focused; logic lives in backend services.
E1_separation_of_concerns.notes: Clear architecture with data loading, transformation, and presentation in distinct layers. Full-stack separation is well-executed. Frontend lib/ is lean (just api.ts and types.ts) since business logic resides on the backend.

E2_readability_naming.evidence: Python: normalize_score, assign_quadrant, build_matrix_data, build_dashboard_data, load_project, apply_temporal_logic — all descriptive and domain-appropriate. TypeScript: formatCurrency, getMatrixData, CustomTooltip, StrategyMatrix, MetricCard, PhaseIndicator, StatusBadge — well-named. Consistent conventions: camelCase in TS, snake_case in Python. Files organized logically (services/, components/dashboard/, components/shared/).
E2_readability_naming.notes: Clean, self-documenting code. Functions are well-named and focused. Domain-appropriate naming throughout (strategic_value, quadrant, confidence). Consistent conventions across both Python and TypeScript codebases.

E3_error_handling.evidence: src/lib/api.ts:12 — fetchJSON throws on non-ok response. api.ts:26-29 — getProject catches errors and returns undefined. src/app/error.tsx — error boundary with reset. src/app/not-found.tsx — 404 page. src/app/projects/[slug]/page.tsx:32 — notFound() on missing project. useEffect cancellation tokens: projects/page.tsx:28-40, roadmap/page.tsx:47-55. backend/governance.py:68-73 — _parse_date handles invalid dates. Missing: no validation on API responses, content_loader.py would crash on malformed frontmatter.
E3_error_handling.notes: Basic error handling present: error boundaries, 404 handling, useEffect cancellation, date parsing guards. However, no runtime validation of API response data on the frontend, and the content loader has no try/catch for malformed markdown files.

E4_dependency_choices.evidence: Frontend: recharts ^2.15.0 (PRD-recommended scatter chart library), fuse.js ^7.0.0 (PRD Section 7.1 recommendation), next ^15.1.0, react ^19.0.0, tailwindcss ^4.0.0. Backend: Django 6.0.2 + DRF 3.16.1, python-frontmatter 1.1.0, markdown2 2.5.4. All versions current. No unnecessary dependencies.
E4_dependency_choices.notes: Well-chosen stack: recharts and fuse.js match PRD recommendations exactly. Versions are current. The Django backend adds infrastructure complexity that could have been avoided with Next.js API routes, but it's a legitimate architectural choice providing clean separation.

E_code_quality.category_commentary: Good code quality with clear separation of concerns and clean naming. Error handling is adequate but has gaps — no frontend data validation and fragile content loader. Dependencies are well-chosen and align with PRD recommendations.

F1_dashboard.evidence: src/app/page.tsx — Dashboard with: Total Investment metric card (line 27), Projected ROI card (line 31), Active Projects count (line 36), Max Concurrent slots (line 41). PhaseIndicator component (line 52). VelocityChart bar chart (line 57). Status breakdown with progress bars (lines 60-89). Portfolio overview with all projects (lines 93-115). All data derived from backend API calculations in governance.py.
F1_dashboard.notes: Full dashboard: all PRD-specified widgets, real calculations (Total Investment summed from projects, ROI multiplier, active count), phase indicator, velocity chart, status breakdown. Visually polished with metric cards, progress bars, and project links.

F2_additional_pages.evidence: Beyond /matrix: / (Dashboard — full metrics + charts), /roadmap (Gantt chart with timeline, grouping, today line), /projects (Library with card/table views, multi-filter), /projects/[slug] (Detail with tabs, metadata sidebar, related projects), /updates (empty state placeholder). 5 additional routes with meaningful content.
F2_additional_pages.notes: Near-complete page coverage. Each page has purpose-built content: dashboard with widgets, Gantt chart with timeline, project library with dual view modes, project detail with tabs and rich metadata, updates with proper empty state.

F3_search_filtering.evidence: TopBar.tsx:59-69 — Cmd+K keyboard shortcut. TopBar.tsx:17-26 — Fuse.js with PRD Section 7.1 key weighting (title:1.0, id:0.8, tags:0.6, owner:0.4, content_html:0.2). StrategyMatrix.tsx:99-134 — department and phase checkbox filters. Projects page.tsx:109-206 — status dropdown, department dropdown, sort selector, cost range slider, ROI range slider, card/table view toggle. Roadmap page.tsx:138-147 — group by department/status.
F3_search_filtering.notes: Multi-faceted filtering across multiple pages. Fuzzy search with Fuse.js and PRD-specified key weighting. Cmd+K trigger. Filters update views in real-time. Filter state does not persist across page navigation.

F4_creative_additions.evidence: globals.css:30-57 — print stylesheet (hides sidebar, cleans up cards, shows all tab content). Dockerfile + docker-compose.yml — full Docker deployment support. StrategyMatrix.tsx:140-167 — brush-to-zoom on chart. ProjectTabs.tsx:22-27 — HTML sanitization for security. Custom SVG icons throughout Sidebar.tsx (no icon library dependency). TopBar.tsx:48-50 — fiscal week calculation.
F4_creative_additions.notes: Useful additions: print stylesheet and Docker support are notable. Brush-to-zoom enhances the chart interaction. HTML sanitization shows security awareness. Custom SVG icons avoid an extra dependency.

F_bonus_features.category_commentary: Impressive bonus feature coverage. Full dashboard, near-complete page set, sophisticated filtering with Fuse.js, and thoughtful additions like print styles and Docker support. Demonstrates strong product thinking and ambition.

G1_prioritization.evidence: Must-have (Strategy Matrix) is excellent: premium chart rendering (A4=4), perfect quadrant logic (D2=4), exemplary pipeline architecture (A6=4). Bonus work is strategically chosen: dashboard with real calculations, Gantt chart timeline, project library with multi-faceted filtering, Fuse.js search matching PRD spec. Together these form a coherent, usable tool — not just a chart.
G1_prioritization.notes: Must-have is excellent. Bonus work demonstrates clear product thinking — dashboard + matrix + project library + Gantt + search = a complete strategic planning tool. The candidate shipped an impressive amount of functionality with consistent quality.

G2_pr_description.evidence: No PR was created. README_LAUNCH.md provides: architecture overview (Django backend + Next.js frontend), Docker setup instructions, manual setup instructions, environment variables, API endpoint documentation, page route listing. Original README.md unchanged.
G2_pr_description.notes: README_LAUNCH.md serves as useful submission documentation explaining architecture and how to run the app. However, it lacks explanation of what was built vs skipped, architectural decisions, trade-offs, or known limitations. No PR description was submitted.

G_decision_making.category_commentary: Excellent prioritization — shipped a coherent, full-featured product. Documentation is functional (launch guide with setup instructions) but lacks the reflective summary that would demonstrate self-awareness about trade-offs and decisions.

H1_commit_cadence.evidence: 2 commits total: 023a42c 'Initial commit' (2026-02-13), a831ed0 'Implement full-stack Roadmap Engine with Docker support' (2026-02-19). 61 files changed, 5729 insertions in the second commit.
H1_commit_cadence.notes: Essentially a single monolithic commit with all work. No incremental progress visible.

H2_message_quality.evidence: Second commit message 'Implement full-stack Roadmap Engine with Docker support' is descriptive and explains what was built.
H2_message_quality.notes: The one substantive commit message is descriptive. Cannot fully evaluate message quality with only 2 commits.

H3_logical_progression.evidence: All work delivered in a single commit. No discernible progression.
H3_logical_progression.notes: No logical build-up visible — everything was committed at once.

I1_ai_vision_planning.evidence: No documentation of AI-related goals, architecture, or intent found in the repo.
I1_ai_vision_planning.notes: No AI features planned or documented.

I2_ai_implementation.evidence: No AI-related code exists in the repository. No LLM API calls, no AI processing scripts.

top_strengths: Exemplary data pipeline architecture: full-stack separation with Django backend services (content_loader → matrix → governance) feeding a pure React presentation layer. The chart component receives fully prepared data and only handles rendering.

Premium scatter plot implementation: quadrant background zones with distinct colors, labeled axes, data points sized by cost and colored by quadrant, brush-to-zoom interaction — goes well beyond minimum requirements.

Impressive feature coverage: shipped a complete strategic planning tool (dashboard, matrix, Gantt, project library, project detail, search) with consistent quality in a 3-hour timebox. Demonstrates strong product thinking.

Perfect PRD compliance on core logic: quadrant boundaries, axis orientation, normalization math all exactly correct. Additional PRD details implemented (cmd+k search, sidebar structure, print styles).
top_weaknesses: Fixed sidebar breaks mobile layouts: w-64 sidebar with ml-64 content margin means the app is unusable on mobile viewports. No responsive collapse mechanism.
Sparse git history: all work in a single monolithic commit (5729 insertions). No incremental progress visible, making it impossible to understand the development approach.

DRF serializers defined but never called: backend/api/serializers.py has comprehensive validation rules (score ranges, date ordering, status constraints) but views.py never invokes them — the validation is dead code.
No runtime data validation on frontend: API responses are trusted without verification. Content loader has no error handling for malformed markdown files.
standout_moments: Built a full Django+DRF backend from scratch alongside the Next.js frontend — an ambitious full-stack architecture choice for a 3-hour assessment. The backend services (content_loader, matrix, governance) are well-structured.
Implemented brush-to-zoom on the scatter plot chart — a sophisticated interaction that goes well beyond the requirements.
Gantt chart timeline view with today-line indicator, status-colored bars, and group-by toggle — impressive bonus feature with real data.
qualitative_summary.hiring_signal: This is a productive full-stack developer who can ship a polished, coherent product under time pressure. They demonstrate strong architectural instincts (clean service layer, proper separation) and product thinking (chose features that make a usable tool). Key risk areas are mobile/responsive design and defensive coding practices (validation gaps). Would thrive in a role where shipping complete features quickly is valued.
